article: I work as a postal letter carrier in Charlotte. One day several years ago, I drove up to a  _  . Christy, the young divorcee who lived there, was waiting by the roadside. She said that she had a  _  to tell me. About six months  _  it seemed that I had  _  a letter to her which had her street  _  on it but was addressed to another house with the  _  number on a different street in the neighborhood. She decided to  drop off  the letter at the correct house. It turned out that the letter had been  _  for Johnson, who happened to be  _  . They talked for a little while, and later on he  _  . Then they started dating and had been going  _  together ever since. I felt sorry for delivering the letter wrong, but I was  _  that I had brought these nice people together. A few months later a(n)  For Sale  sign went up in Christy's yard, and then wedding  _  were sent out. Soon the house was sold, the wedding happened,  _  Christy, with her kids, moved into Johnson's house. A few months later, I saw a For Sale sign in  _  yard. I feared the  _  might be in trouble, so I made up a(n)  _  to go to their door and  _  on them. Christy opened the door, smiled broadly, and pointed to her huge stomach "We're having twins!" she said, "This house won't be big enough, so we have to  _  ."
